answers.text: committed troops to the Korean War and attempted to ban the Communist Party of Australia in an unsuccessful referendum during the course of that war

qas.question: Over what did the Labor party divide?

answers.text: concerns about the influence of the Communist Party over the Trade Union movement,

qas.question: Why did the Soviet Union lead a coal strike?

context: Menzies came to power the year the Communist Party of Australia had led a coal strike <b7_0>to improve pit miners' working conditions<b7_0/>. That same year Joseph Stalin's Soviet Union exploded its first atomic bomb, and Mao Zedong led the Communist Party of China to power in China; a year later came the invasion of South Korea by Communist North Korea. <a0_0><b3_0>Anti-communism<b3_0/><a0_0/> was a key political issue of the 1950s and 1960s. <b6_0>Menzies<b6_0/> was firmly anti-Communist; he <a1_0><b4_0>committed troops to the Korean War and attempted to ban the Communist Party of Australia in an unsuccessful referendum during the course of that war<b4_0/><a1_0/>. The Labor Party split over <a2_0><b5_0>concerns about the influence of the Communist Party over the Trade Union movement<b5_0/>,<a2_0/> leading to the foundation of the breakaway Democratic Labor Party whose preferences supported the Liberal and Country parties.
